intro: Nautilocalyx panamensis, commonly known as the Panama nautilocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique floral structure and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
